page.title: 03ELMSTEAD HALL,ELMSTEAD.
page.content: Elmstead Hall dates back to the{15th {century.}The present owners have lived at Elmstead Hall for 66 years.There is a{Great Hall}in the middle downstairs, it has a big fire place and a large mahogany table.There is a wooden floor now,as the brick floor was too cold. There are 17 sash windows on the front with three{dummy windows}which have been blocked up with slate and then painted on,this was due to window tax. In the house there are 17 rooms ,all very big. The bedrooms have sloping floors.No one has ever seen a ghost at Elmstead Hall.The house does not belong to the people who live there, but belongs to{Jesus College,Cambridge who bought it in 1934.It is a{listed {building.}That means that it can not be altered on the outside but the occuppant can do what he likes to the inside.
